dcterms:creator: Aranyak Mehta
Amin Saberi
Umesh Vazirani
Vijay Vazirani
dcterms:description: A classical online budgeted matching problem involving advertisers with budgets and ad slots, where the algorithm must allocate ad slots to maximize revenue without knowledge of future bids.
dcterms:title: AdWords Problem

dcterms:creator: Aranyak Mehta
Amin Saberi
Umesh Vazirani
Vijay Vazirani
dcterms:description: A distribution used to model bids in the AdWords problem, characterized by a triangular shape where bids increase linearly up to a certain point.
dcterms:title: Triangular Distribution

dcterms:creator: Aranyak Mehta
Amin Saberi
Umesh Vazirani
Vijay Vazirani
dcterms:description: A distribution used in the AdWords problem characterized by a thick tail, which leads to poor performance for certain algorithms like Greedy.
dcterms:title: Thick-z Distribution

dcterms:creator: Aranyak Mehta
dcterms:description: A distribution that models the characteristics of real-world instances in online matching and ad allocation, generated by a preferential attachment process.
dcterms:title: Powerlaw Distribution

dcterms:creator: Aranyak Mehta
Amin Saberi
Umesh Vazirani
Vijay Vazirani
dcterms:description: A variant of the triangular distribution used in the AdWords problem, where bids are drawn from a uniform distribution over a specified range.
dcterms:title: Triangular-g Distribution
